CatDescriptText: George Christian, guard, Mt. Washington and Emanuel Mollett, distribution clerk, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 10, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that the 'Freedom Riders' should accede to Atty. Gen. Robert Kennedy's request for a 'cooling-off' period in their program to test segregation laws of certain Southern states?" George Christian's answer reads: "I figure like this- if they cool off now, they never will get started again.  There should be no cooling-off period."  Emanuel Mollett's answer reads: "Because the 'Freedom Riders' have received an unofficial sanction from the Government, they could comply with in reason.  But there should not be a complete let-up.  They should still continue to test, but only a few, not as many as before.  And those that have already been started should continue."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of George Christian wearing square patterned button down collared shirt and hat, standing in front of store windows and arched entryway; Portrait of Emanuel Mollett wearing paisley button down collared shirt and hat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
